LONDON, Feb 1 (LPC) - UK investment company 3i Infrastructure has increased its credit facilities to £1bn, providing the company with liquidity to make further investments.


In December, the company received credit approval to increase its existing sustainability-linked revolving credit facility to £600m from £400m through a £200m accordion option.


In January, 3i agreed an additional £400m one-year credit facility from existing lenders.


The RCF, which was originally arranged in November 2021, has as a three-year maturity with two one-year extension options.


The facility pays 150bp over Sonia.


The RCF was arranged by Barclays Bank and ICBC alongside Lloyds Bank, NatWest, National Australia Bank, Royal bank of Canada, SEB and SMBC. Lloyds is facility agent.


The sustainability-linked RCF is aligned to the Loan Market Association’s Sustainability Linked Loan Principles, and the margin adjusts depending on 3i Infrastructure’s performance against ESG targets.


All 3i Infrastructure portfolio companies are implementing sustainability strategies developed in 2020 and are gathering greenhouse gas emissions data.
